meanings.definition: A loft or storage area for hay.
meanings.sent1: The farmer stored his hay in the hayloft.
meanings.sent2: The horses enjoyed playing in the hayloft.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat got stuck in the hayloft and needed rescuing.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a hayloft of memories, each bale holding a different moment.
meanings.sent5: The sun streamed through the cracks in the hayloft, illuminating the golden hay.

meanings.definition: The upper part of a barn used for storing hay.
meanings.sent1: The farmer climbed the ladder to reach the hayloft.
meanings.sent2: The hayloft was filled with the sweet scent of fresh hay.
meanings.sent3: The barn owl nested in the hayloft, keeping watch over the farm at night.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were stacked in the hayloft of his mind, waiting to be sorted through.
meanings.sent5: The children loved to play hide-and-seek in the hayloft, hiding behind the hay bales.
